page.title: 12OUR CHURCHES.
page.content: Among the churches in Sheringham are {St.Peter's (Anglican), St.Joseph's {(Catholic), St.Andrew's (Methodist), {Baptist, Salvation Army, Society of {Friends, Brook Hall Gospel Meeting, {Peace Healing Sanctuary and Christian {Science.} Others in the area are{All {Saints,}Beeston Regis and{Holy Trinity West Runton. There are also the ruins of the 13th century{Augustinian Priory at Beeston. Each church plays an active part in the life of the town. The schools hold carol services at{St. {Peter's}each Christmas and the Infants hold their Nativity plays at{St. {Andrews. The Salvation Army}band is very popular and plays every Sunday in the town near the Clock Tower. Church leaders visit the schools from time to time.{St.Peter's}was built in 1895 and the architect of{St.Joseph's}was Sir Giles Gilbert Scott.
